intro: Gouldia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gouldia, is a species of flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in swampy or seasonally waterlogged soils, thriving in humid, subtropical climates. It produces small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
